Package robot_2_0

Class MemoryRobot

  • java.lang.Object
    • robot_2_0.MemoryRobot
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Robot
    public class MemoryRobot
extends java.lang.Object
implements Robot
    A class representing a robot moving randomly through Positions in a Maze, however it will only revisit a previously visited Position if given no other option.

    • Constructor Summary

    • Method Detail

      • move

        public void move()
          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Changes the internal Position of the MemoryRobot to an adjacent Position not previously visited, unless no other option is available. If no other Position is movable the robot will move one step back to the most recently visited Position and remove the dead-end Position from the list of visited Positions. The dead-end is however added to a list of Positions that the robot has "reversed" from, to avoid the robot getting stuck in a loop of "forgetting" about the dead-end and moving into it.
        Specified by:
        move in interface Robot
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - if no adjacent position is movable

      • getPosition

        public Position getPosition()
        Get the current Position of the robot
        Specified by:

        Returns:
        the current Position of the robot

      • hasReachedGoal

        public boolean hasReachedGoal()
        Check if the current Position of the robot is a goal Position of the internal Maze.
        Specified by:
        hasReachedGoal in interface Robot
        Returns:
        true if the current Position of the robot is a goal.
